election_record.label: Connecticut 1822 State Senate

candidate.name: Truman Moseley
candidate.note: Listed in the Original Election Returns as Colonel Moseley.

overview.note: Elias Perkins received 88 votes as Elisha Perkins.
Seth P. Beers received 39 votes as Seth T. Beers.
Samuel B. Sherwood received 34 votes as Samuel W. Sherwood and 1 vote as Samuel Sherwood.
William Moseley received 6 votes as William O. Moseley.
David Hill received 2 votes as David Hall.
Asa Bacon, Jr. received 15 votes as Asa Bacon.
Samuel A. Foot received 10 votes as Samuel Foot.
Jonathan M. Edwards received 2 votes as Jonathan Edwards.
Thomas S. Williams received 2 votes as Thomas Williams.
Nathaniel Terry received 1 vote as Nathaniel Perry.
John S. Peters received 3 votes as John Peters, 1 vote as John T. Peters and 1 vote as Joseph S. Peters.
Noah B. Benedict received 1 vote as Noah Benedict.
Orange Merwin received 1 vote as Orr Merwin and 1 vote as Orrin Merwin.

sub_unit.name: Ridgefield
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Ridgefield.

sub_unit.name: Sharon
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Sharon.

sub_unit.name: East Haddam
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in East Haddam.

sub_unit.name: Derby
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Derby.

sub_unit.name: Windham
sub_unit.note: Orange Merwin received 98 votes as Orange Marvin.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. State Archives, Connecticut State Library, Hartford.
The Times and Hartford Advertiser (Hartford, CT). April 23, 1822.
The Connecticut Journal (New Haven, CT). April 30, 1822.
